attributes.action: consider awarding Kenneth Mathiesen Dalglish M.B.E. a Knighthood for services to both Association Football and Charity.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As a player:
1969–1990 Celtic & Liverpool    
1971–1986 Scotland 102 caps 30 goals (both national records)

The first to score 100 league goals in both the Scottish and English leagues.

PFA Players' Player of the Year 1983 
Football Writers’ Association Player of the Year 1979, 1983 
Inductee to both the Scottish & English Football Hall of Fame
 
As a manager: 
1985–2000 Liverpool, Blackburn Rovers,
Blackburn Rovers (Director of Football), Newcastle United, Celtic (Director of Football), Celtic 

Awards
1985/86 Manager of the year award 
1987/88 Manager of the year award 
1989/90 Manager of the year award 
1996/97 Manager of the year award 

In 2004, Kenny and his wife Marina founded The Marina Dalglish Appeal to raise money for breast cancer funding.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to " consider awarding Kenneth Mathiesen Dalglish M.B.E. a Knighthood for services to both Association Football and Charity."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page14378.asp

Prime Minister's Office
